title: 110_hr288
content: The "Notch Baby Act of 2007" establishes a new guaranteed minimum primary insurance amount for those eligible during a transitional period. Section 215(a) of the Social Security Act is amended to include provisions for individuals eligible for old-age insurance benefits between 1978 and 1989, ensuring a transitional increase amount based on former law calculations and applicable percentages. The Social Security Act amendments provide transitional increase amounts for individuals eligible for old-age insurance benefits between 1978 and 1989, based on former law calculations and specific applicable percentages. The excess under former law is defined as the difference between the former law primary insurance amount and the recalculated amount without certain provisions. The Social Security Act amendments offer transitional increase amounts for individuals eligible for old-age insurance benefits between 1978 and 1989, based on former law calculations and specific applicable percentages. The applicable former law primary insurance amount is determined by computing or recomputing under specific provisions without certain restrictions. The Social Security Act amendments provide transitional increase amounts for individuals eligible for old-age insurance benefits between 1978 and 1989. The calculation includes specific provisions from former law, such as limitations on computation base years and adjustments to primary insurance amounts. The Social Security Act amendments include transitional increase amounts for individuals eligible for old-age insurance benefits between 1978 and 1989, with specific provisions on computation base years and adjustments to primary insurance amounts. SEC. 3 states the effective date and related rules. The amendments made by this Act are effective as if included in the Social Security Amendments of 1977, with no benefit increases before January 2007. Recomputation of benefits is required for individuals entitled to benefits in December 2006 based on specific provisions. The Commissioner of Social Security will recompute the primary insurance amount for individuals entitled to benefits in December 2006 based on specific provisions, taking into account the amendments made by this Act.
